mdRecord.dcterms:description: This is a newspaper article which appeals "to the Christian men and women of both races" to provide assistance for an "old folks home and orphanage" run by Mrs. H. L. Walker. The home is chartered by the state and governed by a board of directors. Mrs. Walker is the founder and president and the article describes her as, "a lady of sterling character, fine ability, and is deeply interested in the betterment of her race."
mdRecord.dcterms:title: Seeking Assistance for Old Folks Home and Orphanage, 1919
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Clippings (Books, newspapers, etc.)
